body:
On ResNet-50 FPN, our method could further improve the performance with Sync BN. 

| Sync BN  |  Context            | box AP  | mask AP | 
| :--------: | :--------------: | :------: | :-------: |
| ✗             | GC(c3-c5, r16) | 38.6      | 35.1        | 
| ✓             | GC(c3-c5, r16) | 39.4      | 35.7        |

hi @xvjiarui 
have u tried `GN` instead of `Sync BN`?

> hi @xvjiarui
> have u tried `GN` instead of `Sync BN`?

Sorry, I haven't tried `GN`. 
It would be very kind of you if you could try it and open a PR with model.

hi @xvjiarui 
have u tried putting `context_block` to `FPN`, `bbox_head` and `mask_head`?

issue.title: singe GPU train

repository.name: GCNet
repository.description: GCNet: Non-local Networks Meet Squeeze-Excitation Networks and Beyond

issue.body:
if I only have single GPU, how much performence without SyncBacthNorm will dorp ?, Simply to say, training on single GPU could achieve similar performance within +-1% error or not ?  
should I adjust the learning rate to 1/8 of its orignal lr and set more epoch_num to get close result with orignal implements.  
thanks!!!

body: Since we also need to perform experiments on ImageNet and Kinetics classification task, the `context_block` is only inserted into backbone.

mask_rcnn_r4_ct_c3-c5_r50_sbn_fpn_1x.py  

-- | Context | box AP | mask AP
-- | -- | -- | --
BN | - | 37.3 | 34.2
BN | GC(c3-c5, r4) | 37.1 | 33.9
GN | GC(c3-c5, r4) | 35.8 | 32.7

I find your baseline mask rcnn get  37.2 | 33.8 , is it added syncBN?  
its still a little than  the original mmdetection 37.3 | 34.2

I just change syncBN for BN/GN(num_groups=32)  and find it worse more.

Hi, @nemonameless 
I am sorry I couldn't reproduce your result. May I have you BN or GN config file?

thanks for your work。I notice that you are also the author of mmdetection. I have a question about syncBN.
when I use the syncBN in the codebase mmdetection, but I couldn't get better performance. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24266484/57439729-36f2c580-7279-11e9-9fe9-fcff116d0343.png)

syncBN config file like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24266484/57440044-d912ad80-7279-11e9-810d-6a5180fdad99.png)
@RainHxj normalize should be added after line "style='pytorch'"

hello guys, I want to test Syncbn's performance, and did four experiments on COCO below :
1. x101, epoch1 map 0.279 , epoch2 map 0.332
2. x101+Syncbn, epoch1 map 0.048, epoch2 map 0.109
3. x101 + dcn + Syncbn, epoch1 map 0.093, epoch2 map 0.151
4. x101 + gc + dcn + syncbn, epoch1 map 0.312, epoch2 map 0.34 
other configurations are same,  like this [config](https://github.com/xvjiarui/GCNet/blob/master/configs/ct/cascade_mask_rcnn_dconv_c3-c5_x101_32x4d_sbn_fpn_1x.pyl), just replace mask rcnn to rcnn, use 4 P40 GPUs, per gpu imgs =2 , lr= 0.01 , I wonder if where goes wrong, that add Syncbn on backbone, lead so low accuray? 

thx for your help. @xvjiarui

Sorry for the late reply. 
We have updated the results in table. Models will be released very soon.

@walton-wang929 
As mentioned, SyncBN has some stability issue. Your could try to train it longer. 
Since you are using P40, I suggest you train on 4 GPUs and with 4 images per GPU, which could make batch size larger and the training would be more stable. 
Btw, `with_cp` option could save a lot of memory with slight increase of training time.
